topic.title: Searching and Refactoring Operations in WSDL Documents

keywords.indexterm: Editing WSDL Documentssearching and refactoring operations

body.p: offers support to quickly find the declaration of a component, where it is referenced, and to rename it using dedicated operations. When you rename a component, detects all its references and updates them automatically.
The following searching and refactoring operations are available in the main toolbar of for a WSDL document:

li.p:
Document WSDL References
Search References - finds all the references of the component located at the caret position in the defined scope. If a scope is and the current edited resource is not part of the range of determined resources, a warning dialog is displayed. This dialog allows you to define another search scope.

ul.li: Document contextual menu of current editor References Search Search References in... - searches for all the references of the current component. This operation demands that you define the scope of the search operation.

Document WSDL References Search Declarations - finds the declaration of the component located at the caret position in the defined scope. If a scope is defined and the current edited resource is not part of the range of resources determined by this scope, a warning dialog is displayed.

Document contextual menu of current editor References Search Search Declarations in... - searches for the declaration of the current component. This operation demands that you define the scope of the search operation.

Document WSDL References Search Occurrences in File - searches all occurrences of the component located at the caret position in the currently edited file.The results of the search operations are presented in the Results view.
Document WSDL Schema Show Definition - takes you to the location of the definition of the current item.You can also use the shortcut on a reference to display its definition.
